message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The therapy prescribed is most likely isotretinoin, which can cause hyperlipidemia as a major side-effect. It is important to monitor lipid levels during treatment. Hyperglycemia, fatigue, and alopecia are not major side-effects of this therapy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The derivative of vitamin A that is commonly used for acne vulgaris is isotretinoin, which is known to cause hyperlipidemia as a major side-effect. It can also cause other side-effects such as dry skin and mucous membranes, and rarely, depression and suicidal thoughts. Hyperglycemia, fatigue, and alopecia are not commonly associated with isotretinoin therapy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The major side-effect of therapy with vitamin A derivatives for acne vulgaris is hyperlipidemia. This is due to an increase in triglyceride and cholesterol levels, which can increase the risk for cardiovascular disease. Hyperglycemia, fatigue and alopecia are not major side-effects of this therapy.
